<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	1.11 &#147;
<U>
	Lease Term
</U>
	&#148; shall mean a period commencing on the date upon which Landlord&#146;s Work (as hereinafter defined)
	is Substantially Complete (as hereinafter defined) (the &#147;
<U>
	Commencement Date
</U>
	&#148;) and ending approximately thirty-nine (39)&nbsp;months thereafter (the &#147;
<U>
	Expiration Date
</U>
	&#148;), unless sooner terminated as provided herein.
	After the Commencement Date, Landlord and Tenant shall execute a Commencement Date Certificate in the form of
<U>
	Exhibit E
</U>
	(
<U>
	Form of Commencement Date Certificate
</U>
	) attached hereto.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	1.12 &#147;
<U>
	Lease Year
</U>
	&#148; shall mean the twelve (12)&nbsp;month period commencing on the Commencement Date, and ending at midnight on
	the day before the anniversary of the Commencement Date; provided, however, that if the Commencement Date does not occur on the first day of a calendar month, the first Lease Year shall end at midnight on the last day of the calendar month which
	includes the first anniversary of the Commencement Date.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	1.13 &#147;
<U>
	Legal Requirements
</U>
	&#148; shall mean all applicable laws,
	statutes, codes, ordinances, orders, rules, regulations, certificates of occupancy, conditional use or other permits, variances, covenants and restrictions of record, the requirements of Landlord&#146;s insurance carrier or any fire insurance
	underwriters, rating bureaus or government agencies, and the requirements of all federal, state, county, municipal and other government authorities, including the requirements of the Americans with Disabilities Act (&#147;
<U>
	ADA
</U>
	&#148;), now in
	effect or which may hereafter come into effect during the Lease Term.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	2
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage128"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	1.14 &#147;
<U>
	Operating Expenses
</U>
	&#148; are defined in
<U>
	Exhibit C (Provisions Regarding
	Additional Rent
</U>
	) attached hereto.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	1.15 &#147;
<U>
	Operating Hours
</U>
	&#148; shall mean 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. Monday through Friday.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	1.16
<U>
	&#147;Permitted Use
</U>
	&#148; shall mean general office use and no other use or purpose.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	1.17 &#147;
<U>
	Premises
</U>
	&#148; shall mean a portion of the 3
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	rd
</SUP>
	Floor of the Building
	measuring approximately 3,188 rentable square feet, and shown on
<U>
	Exhibit A
</U>
	(
<U>
	Plan of Premises
</U>
	) to this Lease. If the Premises include one or more floors in their entirety, all corridors and restroom facilities located on such full
	floor(s) shall be considered part of the Premises.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	1.18
<U>
	&#147;Property
</U>
	&#148; shall mean the property known as &#147;Lexington
	Crossing&#148; and comprised of five (5)&nbsp;buildings known and numbered as (a)&nbsp;83 Hartwell Avenue, Lexington, Massachusetts, (b)&nbsp;81 Hartwell Avenue, Lexington, Massachusetts, (c)&nbsp;131 Hartwell Avenue, Lexington, Massachusetts,
	(d)&nbsp;70 Westview Street, Lexington, Massachusetts, and (e)&nbsp;20 Maguire Road, Lexington, Massachusetts, together with the parcel(s) of land on which they are located, and any other improvements serving the same.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	1.19 &#147;
<U>
	Rentable Area of the Premises
</U>
	&#148; shall mean 3,188 rentable square feet, as adjusted by Landlord from time to time due to a
	remeasurement of or change in the physical size of the Premises.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	1.20 &#147;
<U>
	Rentable Area of the Building
</U>
	&#148; shall mean 78,717
	rentable square feet, as adjusted by Landlord from time to time due to a remeasurement of or change in the physical size of the Building.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	1.21 &#147;
<U>
	Tax Fiscal Year
</U>
	&#148; shall mean the twelve (12)&nbsp;month fiscal year for the Town of Lexington, Massachusetts, which
	currently commences on July&nbsp;1 of each calendar year and ends on June&nbsp;30 of each subsequent calendar year.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	1.22
	&#147;
<U>
	Taxes
</U>
	&#148; are defined in
<U>
	Exhibit C
</U>
	(
<U>
	Provisions Regarding Additional Rent)
</U>
	attached hereto.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	1.23
	&#147;
<U>
	Tenant&#146;s Pro Rata Share
</U>
	&#148; shall mean 4.05%, which is a fraction, the numerator of which shall mean the Rentable Area of the Premises and the denominator of which shall mean the Rentable Area of the Building, as adjusted by
	Landlord from time to time due to a remeasurement of or change in the physical size of the Premises or the Building. In addition, notwithstanding the foregoing, Landlord may equitably adjust Tenant&#146;s Pro Rata Share for all or part of any item
	or expense or cost reimbursable by Tenant that relates to a repair, replacement, or service that benefits only the Premises or only a portion of the Building or that varies with the occupancy of the Building.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	2.
<U>
	LEASE GRANT/POSSESSION
</U>
	. Except as modified by Landlord&#146;s Work, Landlord leases to Tenant and Tenant leases from Landlord the Premises on an
	&#147;as is,&#148; &#147;where-is,&#148; and &#147;with all faults&#148; basis, together with the right, in common with others, to use the Common Areas. By taking possession of the Premises, Tenant is deemed to have accepted the Premises and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	3
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage129"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	agreed that the Premises are in good order and satisfactory condition, with no representations or warranties of
	any kind or nature, expressed or implied, by Landlord as to the condition of the Premises, the Building, the Property, or the suitability thereof for Tenant&#146;s use. Subject to the terms, covenants and conditions of this Lease, Tenant shall have
	access to the Premises and the Common Areas 24 hours per day, 7 days per week, during the Lease Term.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	3.
<U>
	RENT
</U>
	.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	3.1 Tenant covenants to pay to Landlord during the Lease Term, without any setoff or deduction except as otherwise specifically provided in
	this Lease, the full amount of all Base Rent and Additional Rent due hereunder and the full amount of all such other sums of money as shall become due under this Lease, all of which hereinafter may be collectively called &#147;
<U>
	Rent
</U>
	.&#148; In
	addition, Tenant shall pay, as Additional Rent, all rent, sales and use taxes or other similar taxes, if any, levied or imposed by any city, county, state or other governmental body having authority, such payments to be in addition to all other
	payments required to be paid by Tenant to Landlord under this Lease. Such payments shall be paid concurrently with payments of Taxes. Base Rent and Additional Rent for each calendar year or portion thereof during the Lease Term, shall be due and
	payable in advance in monthly installments on the first day of each calendar month during the Lease Term, without demand. If the Lease Term commences on a day other than the first day of a month or terminates on a day other than the last day of a
	month, then the installments of Base Rent and Additional Rent for such month or months shall be prorated, based on the number of days in such month. All amounts received by Landlord from Tenant hereunder shall be applied first to the earliest
	accrued and unpaid Rent then outstanding. Tenant&#146;s covenant to pay Rent shall be independent of every other covenant set forth in this Lease.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	3.2 To the extent allowed by law, if Tenant fails to pay any Base Rent, Additional Rent, or other item of Rent when due and payable hereunder,
	such item (a)&nbsp;shall bear interest at the Default Rate from the date due until the date paid and (b)&nbsp;shall bear a &#147;
<U>
	Late Charge
</U>
	&#148; equal to five percent (5%)&nbsp;of the unpaid amount, both (a)&nbsp;and (b)&nbsp;of which shall
	be due and payable to Landlord immediately upon demand. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Tenant shall be entitled to a grace period of five (5)&nbsp;days after written notice from Landlord with respect to the first late payment in any calendar year.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	3.3 Additional Rent payable hereunder shall be adjusted from time to time in accordance with the provisions of
<U>
	Exhibit C
</U>
	(
<U>
	Provisions Regarding Additional Rent
</U>
	) attached hereto.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	3.4 Tenant&#146;s obligation so to pay Rent under this Lease shall be
	absolute, unconditional, and independent and shall not be discharged or otherwise affected by any law or regulation now or hereafter applicable to the Premises, or any other restriction on Tenant&#146;s use, or, except as otherwise specifically
	provided in this Lease, any casualty or taking, or any failure by Landlord to perform or other occurrence; and Tenant waives all rights now or hereafter existing to quit or surrender this Lease or the Premises or any part thereof, or to assert any
	defense in the nature of constructive eviction to any action seeking to recover Rent.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	4
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage130"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	3.5 Provided that Tenant is not then in an Event of Default (as hereinafter defined) under this
	Lease, then, during the first three (3)&nbsp;months of the Lease Term (the &#147;
<U>
	Rent Abatement Period
</U>
	&#148;), Tenant shall not be obligated to pay any Base Rent otherwise attributable to the Premises during such Rent Abatement Period (the
	&#147;
<U>
	Rent Abatement
</U>
	&#148;). Landlord and Tenant acknowledge and agree that the amount of the Rent Abatement equals $13,949.49 (3 x $4,649.83 = $13,949.49). Tenant acknowledges and agrees that the foregoing Rent Abatement has been granted to
	Tenant as additional consideration for entering into this Lease, and for agreeing to pay the rental and performing the terms and conditions otherwise required under this Lease. If, prior to the expiration of the Rent Abatement Period, Tenant shall
	be in an Event of Default under this Lease, beyond any applicable notice and grace period, or if this Lease is terminated for any reason other than Landlord&#146;s breach of this Lease, fire or other casualty (pursuant to Section&nbsp;18), or
	eminent domain (pursuant to Section&nbsp;19), then the dollar amount of the unapplied portion of the Rent Abatement as of the date of such default or termination, as the case may be, shall be converted to a credit to be applied to the Base Rent
	applicable at the end of the Lease Term and Tenant shall immediately be obligated to begin paying Base Rent for the Premises in full. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained herein, at any time prior to or during the Rent Abatement
	Period, Landlord shall have the option to purchase, by check or wire transfer of available funds, all or any part of the remaining Rent Abatement, by providing Tenant with written notice thereof (&#147;
<U>
	Landlord&#146;s Rent Abatement Purchase
	Notice
</U>
	&#148;). Landlord&#146;s Rent Abatement Purchase Notice shall set forth the total portion of the remaining Rent Abatement that Landlord elects to purchase (the &#147;
<U>
	Purchase Amount
</U>
	&#148;). The Purchase Amount shall be paid by
	Landlord to Tenant simultaneously with the giving of Landlord&#146;s Rent Abatement Purchase Notice. Upon Landlord&#146;s tender of the Purchase Amount, the Rent Abatement shall be reduced by the number of months of Rent Abatement so purchased by
	Landlord. Upon request by Landlord, Landlord and Tenant shall enter into an amendment to this Lease to reflect the Purchase Amount paid by Landlord and the corresponding reduction of the Rent Abatement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	4.
<U>
	SECURITY DEPOSIT/LETTER OF CREDIT
</U>
	. Simultaneously with the execution and delivery of this Lease, Tenant shall deliver to Landlord the sum of
	$13,949.49 (the &#147;
<U>
	Security Deposit
</U>
	&#148;). During the Lease Term, including any extensions thereof, and for sixty (60)&nbsp;days after the expiration of the Lease Term, or for so long thereafter as Tenant is in possession of the Premises
	(or any portion thereof) or has unsatisfied obligations hereunder to Landlord, the Security Deposit shall be held by Landlord without liability for interest and as security for the full and timely performance by Tenant of Tenant&#146;s covenants and
	obligations under this Lease, it being expressly understood that the Security Deposit shall not be considered an advance payment of Rent or a measure of Tenant&#146;s liability for damages in case of any failure by Tenant to perform any of
	Tenant&#146;s covenants or obligations hereunder. Landlord shall not be required to keep the Security Deposit separate from its other accounts, and shall have no fiduciary responsibilities or trust obligations whatsoever with regard to the Security
	Deposit. Tenant shall have no right to require Landlord to so draw and apply the Security Deposit, nor shall Tenant be entitled to credit the same against Rent or other sums payable hereunder. Landlord may, from time to time, without prejudice to
	any other remedy, use the Security Deposit to the extent necessary to cure or attempt to cure, in whole or in part, any failure by Tenant to perform any of Tenant&#146;s covenants or obligations hereunder, without waiving any rights or remedies as a
	result of such failure. Following any such application of the Security Deposit, Tenant shall pay to Landlord within five (5)&nbsp;days after demand the amount so applied in order to restore the Security Deposit to its original amount, and failure to
	so restore within such time period shall be an Event
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	5
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage131"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	of Default (as hereinafter defined) hereunder giving rise to all of Landlord&#146;s rights and remedies
	applicable to an Event of Default in the payment of Rent. If Tenant does not have any unsatisfied obligations hereunder at the termination of this Lease (or thereafter if Tenant is in possession of the Premises (or any portion thereof)), the balance
	of the Security Deposit remaining after any such application shall be returned by Landlord to Tenant within sixty (60)&nbsp;days thereafter. If Landlord transfers its interest in the Premises during the Lease Term, Landlord shall assign the Security
	Deposit to the transferee and thereafter shall have no further liability for the return of such Security Deposit. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained herein, provided that Tenant shall not be in an Event of Default (beyond any
	applicable notice and grace period) on the twelve-month anniversary of the Commencement Date, the Security Deposit shall be decreased to $9,299.66 on the twelve-month anniversary of the Commencement Date. If Tenant shall be in an Event of Default
	(beyond any applicable notice and grace period) on the twelve-month anniversary of the Commencement Date, the Security Deposit then in effect shall remain in place (without reduction) for the balance of the Lease Term.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	5.
<U>
	USE
</U>
	. The Premises shall be used for the Permitted Use and for no other use or purpose. Tenant agrees not to use or permit the use of the Premises for
	any purpose which is illegal or dangerous, which creates a nuisance, or which increases the cost of insurance coverage with respect to the Building. Tenant will conduct its business and control its agents, employees, contractors, servants,
	licensees, and invitees (&#147;
<U>
	Tenant&#146;s Agents
</U>
	&#148;) in such a manner as not to interfere with or disturb other tenants or Landlord in the management of the Property. Tenant will maintain the Premises in a clean and healthful condition,
	and comply with all Legal Requirements with reference to the use, condition, configuration or occupancy of the Premises.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	6.
<U>
	ENVIRONMENTAL HAZARDS
</U>
	.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	6.1 Tenant and Tenant&#146;s Agents shall not use, maintain, generate, allow or bring on the Premises or the Property or transport or
	dispose of, on or from the Premises or the Property (whether into the ground, into any sewer or septic system, into the air, by removal off-site or otherwise) any Hazardous Matter (as hereinafter defined).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	6.2 Tenant shall promptly deliver to Landlord copies of any notices, orders or other communications received from any governmental agency or
	official affecting the Premises and concerning alleged violations of the Environmental Requirements (as hereinafter defined).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	6.3 Tenant
	shall save Landlord, together with Landlord&#146;s members and managers, and their respective members and managers, partners, shareholders, officers, directors, agents and employees (&#147;
<U>
	Landlord&#146;s Agents
</U>
	&#148;), harmless and
	indemnified from and against any and all Environmental Damages (as hereinafter defined) which may be asserted by any person or entity, or government agency, or which the indemnified parties may sustain or be put to on account of: (a) the presence or
	release of any Hazardous Matter in, upon or from the Property (including the Premises) caused by the act or omission of Tenant or Tenant&#146;s Agents; (b)&nbsp;the act or omission of Tenant or Tenant&#146;s Agents in violation of Environmental
	Requirements; and (c)&nbsp;the breach of any of Tenant&#146;s obligations under Section&nbsp;6.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	6
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage132"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	6.4 The provisions of this Section shall be in addition to any other obligations and liabilities
	Tenant may have to Landlord under this Lease or otherwise at law or equity, and in the case of conflict between Section&nbsp;6 and any other provision of this Lease, the provision imposing the most stringent requirement on Tenant shall control. The
	obligations of Tenant under Section&nbsp;6 shall survive the expiration or earlier termination of this Lease and the transfer of title to the Premises.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	6.5 The following terms as used herein shall have the meanings set forth below:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(a) &#147;
<U>
	Hazardous Matter
</U>
	&#148; shall mean any substance: (i)&nbsp;which is or becomes defined as Hazardous Substance, Hazardous Waste,
	Hazardous Material, Oil or similar substance or material under any Legal Requirements, including, without limitation, The Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation and Liability Act, 42 U.S.C. Section&nbsp;9601 et seq., and the regulations
	promulgated thereunder, as the same may be amended from time to time; or (ii)&nbsp;which is toxic, explosive, corrosive, flammable, infectious, radioactive, carcinogenic, mutagenic or otherwise hazardous to health or the environment and which is or
	becomes regulated and the presence of which requires investigation or remediation pursuant to all applicable law
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(b)
	&#147;
<U>
	Environmental Requirements
</U>
	&#148; shall mean all applicable law, the provisions of any and all approvals, and the terms, covenants and conditions of this Lease insofar as the same relate to the release, maintenance, use, keeping in
	place, transportation, disposal or generation of Hazardous Matter, including, without limitation, those pertaining to reporting, licensing, permitting, health and safety of persons, investigation, containment, remediation, and disposal.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(c) &#147;
<U>
	Environmental Damages
</U>
	&#148; shall mean all liabilities, injuries, losses, claims, damages (whether punitive, special,
	consequential or otherwise), settlements, attorneys&#146; and consultants&#146; fees, fines and penalties, interest and expenses, and costs of environmental site investigations, reports and cleanup, including, without limitation, costs incurred in
	connection with any investigation or assessment of site conditions or of health of persons using the Building or the Property; risk assessment and monitoring; any cleanup, remedial, removal or restoration work required by any governmental agency or
	recommended by Landlord&#146;s environmental consultant; any decrease in value of the Property; any damage caused by loss or restriction of rentable or usable space in the Property; or any damage caused by adverse impact on marketing or financing of
	the Property.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	7.
<U>
	RULES AND REGULATIONS
</U>
	. Tenant agrees to comply with, and cause Tenant&#146;s Agents to comply with, the rules and regulations (the
	&#147;
<U>
	Rules and Regulations
</U>
	&#148;) of the Property attached hereto as
<U>
	Exhibit B
</U>
	(
<U>
	Rules and Regulations
</U>
	) and Landlord&#146;s commercially reasonable changes thereto. In the event of a conflict between the terms, covenants and
	conditions of this Lease and the Rules and Regulations, the terms, covenants and conditions of this Lease shall control.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	7
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage133"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	8.
<U>
	INITIAL IMPROVEMENTS TO THE PREMISES
</U>
	.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	8.1
<U>
	Landlord&#146;s Work
</U>
	.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(a) Landlord, at Landlord&#146;s sole cost and expense, shall perform the work (&#147;
<U>
	Landlord&#146;s Work
</U>
	&#148;) set forth in the job
	budget (the &#147;
<U>
	Job Budget
</U>
	&#148;) prepared by Vantage Builders, Inc., dated May&nbsp;22, 2014, consisting of two (2)&nbsp;pages, and attached hereto as
<U>
	Exhibit D (Job Budget
</U>
	) in order to deliver the Premises in accordance with the
	space plan prepared by Design-Science, dated April&nbsp;29, 2014, consisting of one (1)&nbsp;page, and attached hereto as
<U>
	Exhibit A
</U>
	(
<U>
	Plan of Premises)
</U>
	.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(b) Subject to delays due to events of Force Majeure (as hereinafter defined) or Tenant Delay (as hereinafter defined), Landlord shall use
	reasonable care and diligence to complete Landlord&#146;s Work as quickly and efficiently as possible, but Tenant shall have no claim against Landlord for failure to complete Landlord&#146;s Work; provided, however, that in the event that Landlord
	does not Substantially Complete (as hereinafter defined) Landlord&#146;s Work on or before June&nbsp;27, 2014 (the
<U>
	&#147;Outside Completion Date
</U>
	&#148;), Landlord shall provide Tenant with a license to use a portion of the 2
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	nd
</SUP>
	Floor of the Building measuring approximately 2,426 rentable square feet, and shown on
<U>
	Exhibit F
</U>
	(
<U>
	Plan of Temporary Premises
</U>
	) to this Lease (the &#147;
<U>
	Temporary Premises
</U>
	&#148;).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(c) Landlord&#146;s Work shall be performed in a Building Standard manner using Building Standard materials.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(d) If Tenant wants Landlord to perform or supply any additional work or non-Building Standard work, installations, materials or finishes
	(&#147;
<U>
	Extra Work
</U>
	&#148;) over and above, or in lieu of, Landlord&#146;s Work, Landlord may refuse such request for Extra Work. Any agreement to do Extra Work must be in writing describing the Extra Work, the price to be paid by Tenant and any
	payment terms therefor. Any and all costs incurred for the preparation, filing or approval of plans and specifications relating to Extra Work shall be paid for by Tenant without regard to whether or not Landlord agrees to do Extra Work. If Tenant
	fails to make any agreed payment for Extra Work within five (5)&nbsp;days after Landlord invoices Tenant for the same, Landlord shall have the same remedies against Tenant for such non-payment as for non-payment of any other item of Rent.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(e) Notwithstanding anything contained herein or elsewhere in this Lease to the contrary, if there is any increase in Landlord&#146;s cost for
	Landlord&#146;s Work or if Landlord is delayed in substantial completion of Landlord&#146;s Work as a result of: (i)&nbsp;Landlord&#146;s performance of Extra Work; or (ii)&nbsp;the performance of any work by Tenant or Tenant&#146;s Agents, then, in
	such event, (a)&nbsp;Tenant shall be responsible for the increase in Landlord&#146;s cost for Landlord&#146;s Work, and (b)&nbsp;the Commencement Date shall be deemed to be the date on which Landlord&#146;s Work would have been Substantially
	Complete but for the delay.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(f)
<U>
	Substantial Completion of Landlord&#146;s Work
</U>
	. Landlord&#146;s Work shall be deemed
	&#147;
<U>
	Substantially Complete
</U>
	&#148; when Landlord&#146;s construction representative certifies that Landlord&#146;s Work has been completed in accordance with the Job Budget and the Plan of Premises, Punchlist Items (as hereinafter defined)
	excepted.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(g)
<U>
	Tenant Delay
</U>
	. A &#147;
<U>
	Tenant Delay
</U>
	&#148; shall be defined as any act or omission by Tenant, or Tenant&#146;s
	Agents, which causes an actual delay in the performance of Landlord&#146;s Work. Notwithstanding the foregoing, no event shall be deemed to be a Tenant Delay unless and until Landlord has given Tenant written notice (the &#147;
<U>
	Tenant Delay
	Notice
</U>
	&#148;) advising Tenant: (i)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	8
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage134"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	that a Tenant Delay is occurring, (ii)&nbsp;of the basis on which Landlord has determined that a Tenant Delay is
	occurring, and (iii)&nbsp;the actions which Landlord believes that Tenant must take to eliminate such Tenant Delay and Tenant has failed to correct the Tenant Delay specified in the Tenant Delay Notice within forty-eight (48)&nbsp;hours following
	receipt of the Tenant Delay Notice. No period of time prior to the expiration of the cure period shall be included in the period of time charged to Tenant pursuant to such Tenant Delay Notice.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(h)
<U>
	Punchlist Items
</U>
	. Promptly following delivery of the Premises to Tenant with Landlord&#146;s Work with respect thereto Substantially
	Complete, Landlord, Tenant and their respective construction representatives shall inspect the Premises and prepare a list of outstanding items which need to be completed to make Landlord&#146;s Work comply with the Job Budget (&#147;
<U>
	Punchlist
	Items
</U>
	&#148;). Landlord shall use good faith to complete all Punchlist Items within sixty (60)&nbsp;days of the date of the Punchlist. If Landlord fails to complete any Punchlist Items as a result of events of Force Majeure or Tenant Delay,
	Landlord shall have such additional time as is reasonably necessary to complete the delayed Punchlist Items.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	8.2
<U>
	Tenant&#146;s
	Work
</U>
	.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(a)
<U>
	Cost of Tenant&#146;s Work; Priority of Work
</U>
	. Landlord agrees to allow Tenant access to the Premises fourteen
	(14)&nbsp;days prior to the Commencement Date for the sole purpose of installing Tenant&#146;s furniture, fixtures and equipment (&#147;
<U>
	Tenant&#146;s Work
</U>
	&#148;) and Cable Work (as hereinafter defined). Tenant&#146;s Work shall be performed
	at Tenant&#146;s sole cost and expense. Landlord and Tenant shall each take commercially reasonable measures to ensure that Landlord&#146;s contractors and Tenant&#146;s contractors cooperate in commercially reasonable ways with each other to avoid
	any delay in either Landlord&#146;s Work or Tenant&#146;s Work or any conflict with the performance of either Landlord&#146;s Work or Tenant&#146;s Work, Tenant acknowledging, however, that in the case of conflict that is not reasonably avoidable,
	the performance of Landlord&#146;s Work shall have priority. Tenant shall reimburse Landlord, within thirty (30)&nbsp;days after demand therefor, for any out-of-pocket expenses (including third-party charges) incurred by Landlord in connection with
	the performance of Tenant&#146;s Work. Tenant shall not perform any portions of Tenant&#146;s Work outside of normal construction hours (i.e., outside of 6:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. on Business Days) (&#147;
<U>
	After-Hours Work
</U>
	&#148;) without the
	prior written consent of Landlord. Tenant acknowledges and agrees that (i)&nbsp;if Tenant performs any After-Hours Work, and (ii)&nbsp;such After-Hours Work (a)&nbsp;requires access to any areas outside of the Premises, or (b)&nbsp;affects the
	exterior, architectural design or structural components of the Building, or affects the Building systems (including, without limitation, the roof, mechanical, electrical, plumbing, heating, ventilation, and air conditioning
	(&#147;
<U>
	HVAC
</U>
	&#148;), telecommunication, life safety, and security systems), then Tenant shall (y)&nbsp;give Landlord at least twenty-four (24)&nbsp;hours&#146; notice of such After-Hours Work so that Landlord may arrange to have
	Landlord&#146;s supervisory personnel on site, and (z)&nbsp;reimburse Landlord, within thirty (30)&nbsp;days after demand therefor, for the cost of Landlord&#146;s supervisory personnel overseeing the After-Hours Work at the rate of $75.00 per hour.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(b) If Tenant, with Landlord&#146;s prior written approval, takes possession of the Premises prior to the Commencement Date, such
	possession shall be subject to all of the terms, covenants and conditions of this Lease, including, without limitation, Section&nbsp;10 (Alterations, Additions and Improvements to the Premises) and Section&nbsp;15 (Insurance), except that Tenant
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	9
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage135"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	shall not be required to pay Base Rent and Additional Rent with respect to the period of time prior to the
	Commencement Date during which Tenant performs such work; provided, however, that Tenant shall be liable for the cost of any utilities and services that are provided to Tenant during the period of Tenant&#146;s possession prior to the Commencement
	Date. Tenant shall coordinate such entry and installations with Landlord&#146;s property manager.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	8.3
<U>
	Quality and Performance of
	Work
</U>
	. All work required or permitted by this Lease, whether constituting part of Landlord&#146;s Work, Tenant&#146;s Work, Cable Work or Alterations (as hereinafter defined), shall be done in a good and workmanlike manner, by contractors
	approved by Landlord, and in compliance with all Rules and Regulations, construction rules and regulations (&#147;
<U>
	Construction Rules and Regulations
</U>
	&#148;), Legal Requirements, and other provisions (including, without limitation, insurance
	provisions) of this Lease. Each party authorizes the other party to rely upon the written approval or other written authorizations of any construction representative of the party designated by the party in connection with design and construction.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	9.
<U>
	CABLE WORK
</U>
	.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	9.1 Tenant may
	install, maintain, replace, remove (collectively, the &#147;
<U>
	Cable Work
</U>
	&#148;) or use any electronic, phone and data wires, cables, fibers, connections and related telecommunications equipment and/or other facilities for telecommunications
	(collectively, &#147;
<U>
	Cable(s)
</U>
	&#148;) within or serving the Premises, provided: (a)&nbsp;any such installation, maintenance, replacement, removal or use shall comply with Section&nbsp;8.3 (Quality and Performance of Work) and shall not
	interfere with the use of any then-existing Cables within or serving the Building, (b) an acceptable number of spare Cables and space for additional Cables shall be maintained for existing and future occupants of the Building, as determined in
	Landlord&#146;s reasonable opinion, (c) if Tenant at any time uses any equipment that may create an electromagnetic field exceeding the normal insulation ratings of ordinary twisted pair riser Cable or cause radiation higher than normal background
	radiation, the Cables therefor (including riser Cables) shall be appropriately insulated to prevent such excessive electromagnetic field or radiation, (d)&nbsp;Tenant&#146;s rights shall be subject to the rights of any regulated telephone company,
	and (e)&nbsp;Tenant shall pay all costs in connection therewith. Landlord shall at all times maintain exclusive control over all risers (including their use) in the Building. Landlord reserves the right to require that Tenant remove any Cables
	located in or serving the Premises that are installed by or on behalf of Tenant in violation of these provisions, or which are at any time in violation of any applicable Legal Requirements or represent a dangerous or potentially dangerous condition,
	within three (3)&nbsp;days after receipt of notice by Tenant or such longer period of time as is reasonably necessary.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	9.2 Landlord may
	(but shall not have the obligation to) (a)&nbsp;install new Cable at the Building, (b)&nbsp;create additional space for Cable at the Building, and (c)&nbsp;reasonably direct, monitor and/or supervise the installation, maintenance, replacement and
	removal of the allocation and periodic reallocation of available space (if any) for, and the allocation of excess capacity (if any) on, any Cable now or hereafter installed at the Building by Landlord, Tenant or any other party (but Landlord shall
	have no right to monitor or control the information transmitted through) the Cables. Such rights shall not be in limitation of other rights that may be available to Landlord by law, in equity or otherwise. If Landlord exercises any such rights,
	Landlord may charge Tenant for such costs attributable to Tenant, or may include those costs and all other such costs in
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	10
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage136"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Operating Expenses (including without limitation, costs for acquiring and installing Cable and risers to
	accommodate new Cable and spare Cable, any associated computerized system and software for maintaining records of Cable connections, and the fees of any consulting engineers and other experts).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	9.3 Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in this Lease, Landlord reserves the right to require that Tenant remove any or all
	Cables installed by or for Tenant within or serving the Premises upon the expiration or earlier termination of this Lease. Any Cables not required by Landlord to be removed pursuant to this Section&nbsp;9.3 at the expiration or earlier termination
	of this Lease shall, at Landlord&#146;s option, become the property of Landlord (without payment by Landlord). If Tenant fails to remove such Cables as required by Landlord, or violates any other provision of this Section&nbsp;9.3, Landlord may,
	after twenty (20)&nbsp;days&#146; notice to Tenant, remove such Cables or remedy such other violation, at Tenant&#146;s expense (without limiting Landlord&#146;s other remedies available under this Lease, at law or in equity), which amount shall be
	paid by Tenant within fifteen (15)&nbsp;days after Tenant&#146;s receipt of demand by Landlord. Tenant shall not, without the prior consent of Landlord in each instance (which may be withheld in Landlord&#146;s sole and absolute discretion), grant
	to any third party a security interest or lien in or on the Cable, and any such security interest or lien granted without Landlord&#146;s consent shall be null and void. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in this Lease, Landlord
	shall have no liability for damages arising from, and Landlord does not warrant that the Tenant&#146;s use of any Cable will be free from, the following (collectively, &#147;
<U>
	Cable Problems
</U>
	&#148;): (a)&nbsp;any eavesdropping or wiretapping by
	unauthorized parties, (b)&nbsp;any failure of any Cable to satisfy Tenant&#146;s requirements, or (c)&nbsp;any shortages, failures, variations, interruptions, disconnections, loss or damage caused by the installation, maintenance, replacement, use
	or removal of Cables or by any failure of the environmental conditions or the power supply for the Building to conform to any requirements for the Cables or any associated equipment, or any other problems associated with any Cable by any other
	cause. Under no circumstances shall any Cable Problems be deemed an actual or constructive eviction of Tenant, render Landlord liable to Tenant for abatement of Rent or otherwise, or relieve Tenant from performance of Tenant&#146;s other obligations
	under this Lease. Landlord in no event shall be liable for damages by reason of loss of profits, business interruption or other consequential damage arising from any Cable Problems. The provisions of this Section&nbsp;9.3 shall survive the
	expiration or earlier termination of this Lease.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	10.
<U>
	ALTERATIONS, ADDITIONS AND IMPROVEMENTS TO THE PREMISES
</U>
	.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	10.1
<U>
	Generally
</U>
	. Other than Tenant&#146;s Work (which shall be governed by the provisions of Section&nbsp;8 above) and Cable Work (which
	shall be governed by the provisions of Section&nbsp;9 above), Tenant shall not make any alterations, additions, improvements or other changes in or to the Premises (&#147;
<U>
	Alterations
</U>
	&#148;), other than the installation of typical office
	decorations and furnishings which are not affixed to the realty, without the prior written consent of Landlord, which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld, conditioned or delayed; provided, however, that if the proposed Alterations affect the
	exterior, architectural design or structural components of the Building, or affect the Building systems (including, without limitation, the roof, mechanical, electrical, plumbing, heating, ventilation, and air conditioning (&#147;
<U>
	HVAC
</U>
	&#148;),
	telecommunication, life safety, and security systems), Landlord may withhold its consent to such Alterations in Landlord&#146;s sole and absolute discretion. Without limitation, it shall not be
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	11
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage137"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	unreasonable for Landlord to withhold its consent to any Alterations which would require Landlord to make
	improvements to the Building or the Property (or undertake special maintenance, repair or replacement obligations with respect to the Building or the Property) not within the scope of those expressly provided for herein, unless Tenant agrees, at the
	time of its request for approval or notice of such Alterations, to pay all costs associated with Landlord&#146;s improvements or obligations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	10.2
<U>
	Removal
</U>
	. Landlord shall notify Tenant in writing, before the end of the Lease Term, whether or not Tenant&#146;s Work or
	Alterations will be required to be removed by Tenant at the end of the Lease Term. Tenant shall be obligated to remove any Tenant&#146;s Work or Alterations that Landlord has not designated in writing will be permitted to remain on the Premises in
	accordance with Section&nbsp;35. Tenant acknowledges and agrees that any work or alterations (including, without limitation, Tenant&#146;s Work and Alterations) performed by or for the benefit of Tenant shall be the property of Tenant during the
	Lease Term.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	10.3
<U>
	Tenant&#146;s Property
</U>
	. Tenant shall pay, prior to delinquency, all taxes assessed against and levied upon
	Tenant&#146;s Property (as hereinafter defined). If any of Tenant&#146;s Property shall be assessed with Landlord&#146;s real or personal property, Tenant shall pay to Landlord the taxes attributable to Tenant within ten (10)&nbsp;days after receipt
	of a written statement from Landlord setting forth the taxes applicable to Tenant&#146;s Property. As used herein, &#147;
<U>
	Tenant&#146;s Property
</U>
	&#148; includes, but is not limited to, all tangible and intangible goods and accounts, inventory,
	merchandise, furniture, fixtures, equipment (including computer equipment and any data stored thereon) and systems, as well as the property of others held or leased by Tenant or otherwise in the Premises.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	10.4
<U>
	Additional Covenants
</U>
	.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(a) All Alterations shall be made (i)&nbsp;at Tenant&#146;s sole cost and expense, and (ii)&nbsp;according to plans and specifications approved
	in writing by Landlord (to the extent plans and specifications and Landlord&#146;s approval are required).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(b) Tenant shall pay to
	Landlord a fee equal to five percent (5%)&nbsp;of the cost of any Alterations to compensate Landlord for the overhead and other costs it incurs in reviewing the plans therefor and in monitoring the construction of the Alterations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(c) Tenant shall provide Landlord with as-built plans for any Alterations for which plans are used, regardless of whether the Alterations
	require Landlord&#146;s consent hereunder.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(d) Tenant shall provide Landlord with copies of any warranties for Alterations (including
	materials and equipment), and either assign to Landlord, or enforce on Landlord&#146;s behalf, all such warranties to the extent repairs and/or maintenance on warranted items would be covered by such warranties and are otherwise Landlord&#146;s
	responsibility under this Lease.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	12
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage138"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(e) Tenant acknowledges and agrees that Landlord shall have the right to examine and inspect any
	Alterations; provided, however, that no such examination or inspection shall constitute an approval or warranty or give rise to any liability of Landlord with respect thereto.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(f) All Alterations shall be coordinated with any work being performed by, or for, Landlord, and in such a manner as to maintain harmonious
	labor relations with Landlord&#146;s contractors (&#147;
<U>
	Landlord&#146;s Contractors
</U>
	&#148;).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(g) Tenant shall keep all construction
	areas clean and free of trash and debris.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	10.5
<U>
	Mechanic&#146;s Liens
</U>
	. Tenant agrees immediately to discharge (either by payment or
	by filing of the necessary bond or otherwise) any mechanic&#146;s, materialman&#146;s or other lien or encumbrance against the Property which arises out of any payment due for, or purported to be due for, any labor, services, materials, supplies or
	equipment alleged to have been furnished to or for Tenant. If Tenant shall fail to so discharge such lien or encumbrance then, in addition to any other right or remedy of Landlord, Landlord may, but shall not be obligated to, discharge the same
	(either by payment or by filing of the necessary bond or otherwise), and any payment, costs and expenses incurred by Landlord in connection therewith, including reasonable attorneys&#146; fees, shall be repaid by Tenant to Landlord on demand,
	together with interest thereon at the rate set forth in Section&nbsp;1.9 from the date of payment.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	11.
<U>
	SIGNAGE
</U>
	. Tenant shall not place, erect,
	maintain or display any sign or other marking of any kind whatsoever on the windows, doors or exterior walls of the Premises and shall not place any blinds, curtains, drapes or coverings over the exterior windows or on the window surfaces which are
	visible from the outside of the Building. Landlord, at Landlord&#146;s sole cost and expense, shall provide Tenant with Building Standard signage (a)&nbsp;on the directory to the Building lobby and (b)&nbsp;on the directory to the floor on which the
	Premises are located. Landlord acknowledges and agrees that the Building Standard signage described in this Section may be in the name of &#147;Patch Media.&#148;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	12.
<U>
	LANDLORD&#146;S OBLIGATIONS
</U>
	.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	12.1
	Landlord shall provide Tenant with the following services: (a)&nbsp;electricity to the Premises for general office use in accordance with, and subject to the terms, covenants and conditions of, Section&nbsp;14 of this Lease; (b)&nbsp;HVAC during
	Operating Hours to provide a temperature required, in Landlord&#146;s reasonable judgment, for the comfortable occupancy of the Premises in accordance with the Permitted Use; provided, however, that Tenant shall be responsible for the cost of
	electricity necessary to operate the air conditioning serving the Premises during any period when electricity is separately metered pursuant to Section&nbsp;14 of this Lease; (c)&nbsp;water for drinking and restroom facilities; provided, however,
	that Tenant shall be responsible for the cost of water serving any private kitchens or private restrooms; (d)&nbsp;janitorial service in the Premises and the Common Areas on Business Days; (e)&nbsp;passenger elevator service, 24 hours a day, 7 days
	a week; and (f)&nbsp;freight elevator service (to the extent available in the Building) on Business Days, upon request of Tenant, and subject to scheduling with Landlord&#146;s property manager. In the event Tenant requests, and Landlord provides,
	HVAC service to the
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	13
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage139"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Premises outside of Operating Hours, Tenant agrees to pay Landlord for such HVAC service at the then current
	Building rate, which is currently $35.00 per hour per zone. Such hourly rate shall be subject to reasonable adjustments from time to time to reflect increases in Landlord&#146;s costs for providing such additional service.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	12.2 If Tenant requests any other utilities or Building services in addition to or in lieu of those identified in Section&nbsp;12.1, or in
	frequency, scope, quality or quantity substantially greater than the standards set by Landlord for the Building, then Landlord may refuse such request for additional utilities or Building services. Any agreement to provide additional utilities or
	Building services must be in writing describing the additional utilities or Building services, the price to be paid by Tenant, and any payment terms therefor. If Tenant fails to make any agreed payment for additional utilities or Building services
	within thirty (30)&nbsp;days after Landlord invoices Tenant for the same, Landlord shall have the same remedies for such non-payment as it has for non-payment of Rent in addition to whatever other remedies are available to Landlord.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	12.3 Landlord shall not be liable for any failure to supply, or interruption or termination of, in whole or in part, any utilities or Building
	services identified in Section&nbsp;12.1, nor shall the same be construed as an actual or constructive eviction of Tenant, nor give rise to an abatement of Rent, nor relieve Tenant from the obligation to fulfill any covenant or agreement hereof,
	including the payment of Rent. Furthermore, Landlord shall not be liable for loss of property, or injury to, or interference with, Tenant&#146;s business, including, without limitation, loss of profits, however occurring, through or in connection
	with, or incidental to, an interruption or termination of any such utilities or Building services.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	13.
<U>
	MAINTENANCE AND REPAIRS
</U>
	. Except to the
	extent such obligations are expressly imposed upon Landlord hereunder, Tenant shall, at its sole cost and expense, maintain the Premises (including, without limitation, any supplemental electrical or HVAC systems serving Tenant&#146;s computer
	equipment, telecommunication, life safety, and security systems, private kitchens, and private restrooms) in good order, condition and repair throughout the entire Lease Term. Tenant agrees to keep the areas visible from outside the Premises in a
	neat, clean and attractive condition at all times. Tenant shall, within thirty (30)&nbsp;days after Landlord&#146;s written demand therefor, reimburse Landlord for the cost of all repairs and replacements in and to the Premises, the Building, and/or
	the Property (including, without limitation, the facilities and systems thereof), plus an administration charge of ten percent (10%)&nbsp;of such cost, if the need for such repairs and replacements arises out of Tenant&#146;s use or occupancy of the
	Premises.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	14.
<U>
	ELECTRICITY
</U>
	. All electricity used by Tenant in the Premises shall be paid for by Tenant through inclusion in Base Rent and Operating
	Expenses (except as provided below with respect to excess usage). Landlord shall have the right at any time and from time to time during the Lease Term to contract for electricity from such providers of such services as Landlord shall elect (each
	being an &#147;
<U>
	Electric Service Provider
</U>
	&#148;). Tenant shall cooperate with Landlord and the Electric Service Provider, at all times and, as reasonably necessary, shall allow Landlord and the Electric Service Provider reasonable access to
	the Building&#146;s electric lines, feeders, risers, wiring, and any other machinery within the Premises. Tenant&#146;s use of electrical services furnished by Landlord shall not exceed in voltage, rated capacity, or overall load that which is
	standard for the Building. In the event Tenant shall request that it be allowed to consume
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	14
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage140"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	electrical services in excess of Building Standard, Landlord may refuse to consent to such usage or may consent
	upon such conditions as Landlord reasonably elects, and all such excess usage shall be paid for by Tenant as Additional Rent. Landlord, at any time during the Lease Term, shall have the right (a)&nbsp;to separately meter electricity for the
	Premises, in which case electricity shall be paid by Tenant directly to the Electric Service Provider, (b)&nbsp;to sub-meter or check meter electricity for the Premises, in which case electricity shall be paid by Tenant to Landlord as Additional
	Rent, or (c)&nbsp;to measure electrical usage by survey or any other method that Landlord, in its reasonable judgment, deems appropriate.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	15.
<U>
	INSURANCE
</U>
	.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	15.1
<U>
	Intentionally Omitted
</U>
	.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	15.2
<U>
	Tenant&#146;s Insurance
</U>
	. Tenant shall, at all times during the Lease Term (or such earlier or later period as Tenant is in
	possession of the Premises or any portion thereof), procure and maintain at its sole cost and expense:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(a)
<U>
	Property
</U>
	. Property
	insurance in an amount equal to the full replacement cost of Tenant&#146;s Work, Alterations and Tenant&#146;s Property located in the Premises, which shall provide protection against loss by fire and other casualties and risks, on the special
	causes of loss form, including earthquake and flood.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(b)
<U>
	Commercial General Liability
</U>
	. Commercial general liability insurance
	(including contractual, host liquor and personal injury liability insurance) in an amount not less than $1,000,000.00 per occurrence and $2,000,000.00 annual aggregate (or such higher limits as may be determined by Landlord from time to time).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(c)
<U>
	Automobile Liability
</U>
	. Automobile liability insurance for owned, non-owned and hired vehicles in an amount not less than
	$1,000,000.00 per occurrence.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(d)
<U>
	Workers&#146; Compensation and Employers&#146; Liability
</U>
	. The statutory limits of workers&#146;
	compensation and employers&#146; liability insurance in amounts adequate to satisfy the umbrella underlying requirements.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(e)
<U>
	Excess/Umbrella Liability
</U>
	. Umbrella liability coverage in an amount not less than $3,000,000.00 per occurrence and $3,000,000.00 annual aggregate. Umbrella liability coverage is to be in excess of the commercial general liability, automobile
	liability, and workers&#146; compensation and employers&#146; liability requirements outlined in Sections 15.2 (b), (c)&nbsp;and (d)&nbsp;above.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(f) The liability coverage in the insurance policies required in Sections 15.2(b), (c)&nbsp;and (e)&nbsp;above shall name Landlord, together
	with Landlord&#146;s property manager and Landlord&#146;s mortgagee (if any) (&#147;
<U>
	Landlord&#146;s Insured Parties
</U>
	&#148;), as additional insureds on a primary non-contributing basis. All insurance policies required in Sections 15.2(a) &#150;
	(e)&nbsp;above shall be issued by companies authorized to do business in Massachusetts with an A.M. Best&#146;s financial rating of A or better and a size class rating of X (10)&nbsp;or larger or otherwise acceptable to Landlord. At or prior to the
	Commencement Date, Tenant shall deposit with Landlord a
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	15
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage141"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	certified copy of the insurance binder (countersigned by the insurer) or other evidence of insurance satisfactory
	to Landlord for each of the insurance policies Tenant is required to carry in compliance with its obligations under this Lease. If obtainable, such insurance policies shall contain a provision that the insurer will not cancel or refuse to renew the
	policy, or change in any material way the nature or extent of the coverage provided by such policy, without first giving at least thirty (30)&nbsp;days prior written notice to Landlord&#146;s Insured Parties. Tenant&#146;s failure to obtain and
	maintain the required insurance shall constitute an Event of Default under this Lease. If Tenant shall fail to remedy such Event of Default within five (5)&nbsp;days after written notice by Landlord, Tenant will be liable for any and all costs,
	liabilities, damages and penalties resulting to Landlord&#146;s Insured Parties from such termination, unless a written waiver of the specific insurance requirement(s) is provided to Tenant by Landlord&#146;s Insured Parties.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	15.3
<U>
	Insurance During Construction
</U>
	. In addition, during the performance of any construction by Tenant on the Premises, in addition to
	the above coverage required to be maintained by Tenant, Tenant shall cause any general contractors and sub-contractors performing work to carry: (a)&nbsp;commercial general liability insurance in an amount not less than $1,000,000.00 per occurrence
	and $2,000,000.00 annual aggregate (or such higher limits as may be determined by Landlord from time to time); (b)&nbsp;the statutory limits of workers&#146; compensation and employers&#146; liability insurance in amounts adequate to satisfy the
	umbrella underlying requirements; (c)&nbsp;umbrella liability coverage in an amount not less than $3,000,000.00 per occurrence and $3,000,000.00 annual aggregate (to be in excess of the commercial general liability and workers&#146; compensation and
	employers&#146; liability requirements outlined in Sections 15.3 (a) and (b)&nbsp;above); and (d)&nbsp;builder&#146;s risk insurance on the special causes of loss form, including earthquake and flood, to protect Landlord&#146;s and Tenant&#146;s
	interests during the course of the construction with a limit of not less than the total replacement cost of the completed improvements under construction. Such contractor insurance policies shall name Landlord&#146;s Insured Parties as additional
	insureds on a primary non-contributing basis.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	15.4
<U>
	Waiver of Subrogation
</U>
	. Landlord and Tenant hereby release each other from any
	and all liability or responsibility to the other or anyone claiming through or under them by way of subrogation or otherwise for any loss or damage to property caused by fire or other casualty, even if such fire or other casualty shall have been
	caused by the fault or negligence of the other party, or anyone for whom such party may be responsible; provided, however, that this release shall be applicable and in full force and effect only to the extent permitted by law and only to the extent
	that the cost of repairing such damage is covered by insurance or would have been covered by insurance proceeds payable under any policy (including the deductible and/or uninsured portion thereof) required to be maintained under this Lease, but not
	so maintained. Each policy of such insurance shall, if obtainable from the insurer, contain a waiver of subrogation by the insurer against Landlord or Tenant, as the case may be. In the event a party is unable to obtain such a waiver, it shall
	immediately notify the other of this inability. In the absence of such notification, each party shall be deemed to have obtained such a waiver of subrogation.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	16.
<U>
	INDEMNIFICATION
</U>
	. To the maximum extent enforceable by law, but subject to Section&nbsp;15.2 (Tenant&#146;s Insurance) and Section&nbsp;15.4 (Waiver
	of Subrogation), Tenant covenants and agrees to exonerate, indemnify, defend (with counsel reasonably acceptable to Landlord),
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	16
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage142"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	protect and save Landlord, Landlord&#146;s Agents and Landlord&#146;s Insured Parties harmless from and against
	any and all claims, demands, expenses, losses, suits and damages (including reasonable attorneys&#146; fees) as may be occasioned by reason of (a)&nbsp;any accident, injury or damage occurring in or about the Premises causing injury to persons or
	damage to property (including, without limitation, the Premises); (b)&nbsp;the occupancy of the Premises or use of the Common Areas by Tenant or Tenant&#146;s Agents (or any person or entity claiming by, through or under Tenant or Tenant&#146;s
	Agents); (c)&nbsp;any act, omission, negligence or misconduct by Tenant or Tenant&#146;s Agents (or any person or entity claiming by, through or under Tenant or Tenant&#146;s Agents); and (d)&nbsp;the breach or default by Tenant or Tenant&#146;s
	Agents of any representation, covenant, or other term contained in this Lease. Tenant&#146;s obligations hereunder shall include any other matters for which Tenant has agreed to indemnify Landlord pursuant to any other provision of this Lease.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	17.
<U>
	DAMAGES FROM CERTAIN CAUSES
</U>
	. To the maximum extent enforceable by law, but subject to Section&nbsp;15.2 (Tenant&#146;s Insurance) and
	Section&nbsp;15.4 (Waiver of Subrogation), Landlord shall not be liable to Tenant or Tenant&#146;s Agents, or any other person or party claiming through Tenant or Tenant&#146;s Agents, for any accident, injury or damage occurring in or about the
	Premises or the Property causing injury to persons or damage to property (including, without limitation, the Premises) resulting from any accident or occurrence in the Premises or any other portion of the Property caused by (a)&nbsp;Tenant or
	Tenant&#146;s Agents, (b)&nbsp;other tenants of the Property, or (c)&nbsp;any portion of the Property becoming out of repair or by defect in or failure of equipment, pipes, or wiring, or by broken glass, or by backing up of drains, or by gas, water,
	steam, electricity, or oil leaking, escaping or flowing into the Premises.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	18.
<U>
	FIRE OR OTHER CASUALTY
</U>
	.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	18.1 In the event of damage to or destruction of the Premises or the Building caused by fire or other casualty (&#147;
<U>
	Event of
	Casualty
</U>
	&#148;), Landlord shall undertake to make repairs and restorations with reasonable diligence, unless this Lease has been terminated by Landlord or Tenant as hereinafter provided, or unless any mortgagee which is entitled to receive
	casualty insurance proceeds fails to make available to Landlord a sufficient amount of such proceeds to cover the cost of such repairs and restorations. Landlord shall, within forty-five (45)&nbsp;days after Landlord becomes aware of the Event of
	Casualty, provide Tenant with a good faith estimate of the time required to repair the damage to the Premises or the Building, as the case may be. If, in Landlord&#146;s reasonable judgment, the damage is of such nature or extent that (a)&nbsp;more
	than two hundred (270)&nbsp;days after the Event of Casualty would be required (with normal work crews and normal work hours) to repair and restore the Premises or the Building, or (b)&nbsp;less than one (1)&nbsp;year remains on the then current
	Lease Term and more than ninety (90)&nbsp;days after the Event of Casualty would be required (with normal work crews and normal work hours) to repair and restore the Premises or the Building, then the Premises or the Building, as the case may be,
	shall be deemed &#147;substantially damaged.&#148; If the Premises or the Building are deemed substantially damaged, Landlord may elect to terminate this Lease by giving Tenant written notice of such termination within sixty (60)&nbsp;days after the
	Event of Casualty. In addition, if the Premises or the Building are substantially damaged, and if as a result of the same the Premises are rendered untenantable for the Permitted Use, then Tenant may elect to terminate this Lease by giving Landlord
	written notice of such termination within sixty (60)&nbsp;days after the Event of Casualty. If either party elects to terminate this Lease as set forth above, then the Lease Term shall expire
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	17
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage143"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	thirty (30)&nbsp;days after the date such written notice is given, Base Rent and Additional Rent shall be
	equitably abated in accordance with Section&nbsp;18.3 below, and Tenant shall thereafter vacate the Premises and surrender the same to Landlord in accordance with the terms, covenants and conditions of this Lease.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	18.2 In the event this Lease is not terminated pursuant to the terms of Section&nbsp;18.1 above and is otherwise in full force and effect, and
	sufficient casualty insurance proceeds are available for application to such repair and restoration, Landlord shall proceed diligently to repair and restore the Premises or the Building, as the case may be (including Landlord&#146;s Work, if any) to
	substantially the same condition in which it was immediately prior to the casualty occurrence, subject to Legal Requirements. Landlord shall not be obligated to repair or restore (a) any Tenant&#146;s Work or Alterations to the Premises in excess of
	Landlord&#146;s Work, even if such work was performed by Landlord&#146;s Contractors (and regardless of whether or not Tenant is required to remove or leave the same on the Premises at the expiration or earlier termination of this Lease), or
	(b)&nbsp;any of Tenant&#146;s Property, unless Tenant, in a manner satisfactory to Landlord, assures payment in full of all costs as may be incurred by Landlord in connection therewith.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	18.3 When Landlord&#146;s repair and restoration work has been completed, Tenant shall complete the restoration of (a)&nbsp;all of
	Tenant&#146;s Work and Alterations and (b)&nbsp;all of Tenant&#146;s Property which are necessary to permit Tenant&#146;s re-occupancy of the Premises. Landlord shall not be liable for any inconvenience or annoyance to Tenant or injury to the
	business of Tenant resulting in any way from such damage or the repair thereof, except that Base Rent and Additional Rent shall be equitably abated from the date of the damage or destruction until the Premises has been substantially restored for any
	portion of the Premises that is unusable by Tenant. Notwithstanding the foregoing, if such casualty was due to the act or omission of Tenant or Tenant&#146;s Agents, such abatement or reduction shall be made only if and to the extent of any proceeds
	of rental interruption insurance actually received by Landlord and allocated to the Premises.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	19.
<U>
	EMINENT DOMAIN
</U>
	. If the whole or a
	material portion of the Premises shall be taken or condemned by a governmental or quasi-governmental authority for any public or quasi-public use or purpose (including sale under threat of such a taking), or if the owner elects to convey title to
	the condemnor by a deed in lieu of condemnation, or if all or any portion of the Property are so taken, condemned or conveyed and as a result thereof, in Landlord&#146;s reasonable judgment, the Premises cannot be used for Tenant&#146;s Permitted
	Use as set forth herein, then this Lease shall cease and terminate as of the date when title vests in such governmental or quasi-governmental authority and Base Rent and Additional Rent shall be abated on the date when such title vests in such
	governmental or quasi-governmental authority. If less than a material portion of the Premises shall be taken or condemned by a governmental or quasi-governmental authority for any public or quasi-public use or purpose (including sale under threat of
	such a taking), Base Rent and Additional Rent shall be equitably abated on the date when such title vests in such governmental or quasi-governmental authority and this Lease shall otherwise continue in full force and effect. In any case, Tenant
	shall have no claim against Landlord for any portion of the amount that may be awarded as damages as a result of any governmental or quasi-governmental taking or condemnation (or sale under threat or such taking or condemnation); and all rights of
	Tenant to damages therefor are hereby assigned by Tenant to Landlord. The foregoing shall not,
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	18
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage144"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	however, deprive Tenant of any separate award for moving expenses, dislocation damages or for any other award
	which would not reduce the award payable to Landlord. As used herein, &#147;material portion of the Premises&#148; shall mean such amount that, in Landlord&#146;s reasonable judgment, would render the Premises untenantable for the Permitted Use.
</P>
